node.title: Eric Adams Defeats Curtis Sliwa in NYC Mayoral Race
node.description: "This is for all of you," the Democrat told New Yorkers as he wiped away tears after casting his ballot.

node.title: Minneapolis Rejects "Defund the Police" Plan as Crime Surges
node.description: The proposal had drawn significant attention around the country in the wake of calls for police reform.

node.title: Melbourne Cup favourite Incentivise injured
node.description: Beaten Melbourne Cup favourite Incentivise has emerged with a swollen leg after finishing second to Verry Elleegant at Flemington.

node.title: NSW Deputy Premier Paul Toole to call on colleagues to rule out new coal exploration zones
node.description: NSW Deputy Premier Paul Toole says he will be asking colleagues to oppose a proposal to open up new areas for coal exploration.

node.title: Former police officer who claimed vacant houses in property scam has jail term cut
node.description: A former Victoria Police sergeant who used obscure laws to steal houses from her unsuspecting victims has a year shaved off her jail term, but the judges brand her offending "breathtakingly dishonest".

node.title: Covid-19: Hamilton Mayor calls for seperation from region once vaccination target reached
node.description: The mayor of Hamilton wants her city treated differently to the rest of the region once it reaches 90 percent fully vaccinated.

node.title: More debt stress for Auckland and Northland businesses - data
node.description: Auckland and Northland have recorded more debt stress than the rest of Aotearoa, new data from Centrix shows.

node.title: Police Tactical Response Model to be trialled in four areas
node.description: Further details have been announced about the new Police Tactical Response Model set to begin later this month.

node.title: Rakiura Stewart Island bolstered by domestic tourism over pandemic
node.description: With New Zealanders unable to travel overseas, they've flocked to Aotearoa's third-largest island allowing it to buck the trend of most tourist markets.

node.title: Nelson fire destroys isolated bach
node.description: Firefighters have been transported to a fire at an isolated bach on Nelson's Boulder Bank by the Coastguard.

node.title: Minneapolis voters reject an amendment to replace the Police Department.
node.description: The amendment, which grew out of the anger over the murder of George Floyd, called for replacing the city’s police force with a new Department of Public Safety.

node.title: Mike Duggan wins a third term as Detroit’s mayor.
node.description: Mr. Duggan, a Democrat, has presided over a resurgence of Detroit’s downtown and a restoration of basic city services, even as many neighborhoods continue to struggle.

node.title: 'There were elections looming': Ambassador adds political motivation to why French sub deal was scrapped
node.description: The French ambassador suggests Australia's decision to scrap a $90 billion submarine deal could have been politically motivated, given the federal election is just around the corner.

node.title: NSW Premier orders review of how grants are handed out after new  pork barrelling claims
node.description: NSW Premier Dominic Perrottet says he is committed to making sure the grants process is fair after his predecessor Gladys Berejiklian's appearance before the corruption watchdog put government pork barrelling back in the headlines.

node.title: 'Hold that glimmer of hope': Suzie's sister disappeared in 1973, but says the Cleo Smith case shows families should never give up
node.description: Suzie Ratcliffe's sister, Joanne, disappeared from Adelaide Oval in 1973, in what remains one of the nation's most notorious cold cases. She says the "amazing" discovery of Cleo Smith is testament to the tenacity of investigators.

node.title: San Francisco Police Officer Charged With Shooting Man Who Died 3 Years Later
node.description: Officer Kenneth Cha, charged with voluntary manslaughter, “lacked a lawful basis to even arrest” the man and “elevated a nonviolent encounter,” the district attorney said.

node.title: The EU has cottoned on to imperfect carbon workarounds introduced by countries such as Australia and things are about to change
node.description: A carbon tariff is a carbon tax applied to exports from countries like Australia that don't have one. And Europe is planning to impose one, whether our politicians like it or not, writes Peter Martin.

node.title: 'The risk is too great': Health Minister defends Queensland's quarantine requirements for overseas arrivals
node.description: Queensland's Health Minister Yvette D'Ath stands firm on her decision to mandate hotel quarantine for returning overseas travellers after state borders open to interstate COVID hotspots next month.

node.title: Myanmar national in custody after jumping ship near Gisborne
node.description: A person from Myanmar is today in police custody in Gisborne after jumping off a ship at sea near Young Nicks Head last night.

node.title: Proposed UC Santa Barbara dorm faces criticism over lack of windows
node.description: An architect and member of the design review board quit over the project, calling it a "misguided experiment."

node.title: Eric Adams Is Elected Mayor of New York City
node.description: Mr. Adams, a Democrat and former police captain, will be the second Black mayor in the city’s history.

node.title: Voting is over and a winner is expected tonight in the New York City mayor’s race.
node.description: It is unclear when a winner will be declared, but in the 2013 election, the last open-seat mayoral race in the city, the contest was called less than an hour after polls closed.

node.title: How are DHBs across Aotearoa faring in vaccination rates?
node.description: Only five district health boards have hit the milestone for first jabs: Capital and Coast, Auckland, Waitematā, Canterbury, and Southern DHB.

node.title: Health and educational leaders urgently seek clarity over vaccine exemptions
node.description: Health and educational leaders are calling for urgent clarity over vaccine exemption certificates as the cut-off date looms for teachers to get vaccinated. Audio

node.title: Review: ‘Tammany Hall’ Votes the Party Line
node.description: An immersive show at the SoHo Playhouse takes theatergoers back to a speakeasy in 1929, when New York was also in a mayoral race.

node.title: De Blasio votes for his successor as he eyes a campaign for governor.
node.description: By Precious Fondren and Michael Gold

node.title: Michigan Latest State to Allow 'X' Gender Marker on Driver's Licenses
node.description: On Tuesday, head of the Michigan Secretary of State (SOS) Jocelyn Benson announced in a press release that on November 10, Michigan residents will be able to select a non-binary option, labeled as an "X" for both their driver's licenses and state identification cards.

node.title: Why would serial winner Antonio Conte join the Spurs?
node.description: A serial winner with Premier League success on his CV. It is easy to see why Tottenham Hotspur have appointed Antonio Conte as their new manager, but why would he take the position? BBC takes a look.

node.title: L.A. County approves $2.5 million settlement over Kobe Bryant crash photos
node.description: The settlement must now be approved by a court.

node.title: Clashing Portrayals of Kyle Rittenhouse in Testimony on Kenosha Shootings
node.description: Prosecutors described Mr. Rittenhouse as an out-of-town visitor who was armed illegally during tense protests over policing in Kenosha, Wis. His defense team said he was defending himself.

node.title: Democrats consider repeal of SALT deduction cap
node.description: Taxpayers can deduct up to $10,000 of their state and local taxes on their federal income tax.

node.title: Shontel Brown, a Democrat, wins an Ohio House seat in a special election.
node.description: The district, Ohio’s 11th Congressional District, encompasses most of Cleveland and much of Akron.

node.title: EPA Orders Michigan City to Repair Pipes, Better Inform Residents to Help End Water Crisis
node.description: "The people of Benton Harbor have suffered for too long," EPA Administrator Michael S. Regan said.

node.title: ACT records 15 new COVID-19 cases as cluster grows at Wanniassa School
node.description: The ACT has recorded 15 new locally acquired COVID-19 cases as the junior campus of Wanniassa School in Canberra's south closes due to a growing COVID-19 cluster.

node.title: 'It is a challenge, it's not popular' - Minister Mahuta on three waters criticisms
node.description: Local Government Minister Nanaia Mahuta continues to defend the proposed Three Waters reforms, saying people in rural areas should not be left behind the big cities. Audio

node.title: Pilot medical surveillance system 'belongs in dark ages' - expert
node.description: Pilots flying into medical trouble are protesting against a safety system they say is broken.

node.title: The virus is surging on the Navajo Nation, despite high vaccination rates.
node.description: Experts and tribal leaders aren’t sure why, but living near communities with low vaccination rates may be contributing.

node.title: Police say man in custody had 'no family connection' to Cleo Smith
node.description: WA police hail the successful search for Cleo Smith as "one of the most remarkable days in policing in Western Australia" and thank her parents and community for their resilience,

node.title: Fond memories, sad farewell as demolition begins on Gundagai's historic timber bridge
node.description: Gundagai's Prince Alfred Bridge has held a special place in the hearts of locals for generations, but after more than a century of service it is coming down.

node.title: Carole Baskin sues Netflix over "unauthorized footage" in "Tiger King 2"
node.description: The complaint claims "Tiger King 2" uses unauthorized footage of the plaintiffs and alleges they will suffer "irreparable harm" if the show is released.

node.title: For Holocaust Scholar, Another Confrontation with Neo-Nazi Hate
node.description: In a Charlottesville courtroom, Deborah E. Lipstadt will testify to the persistence of antisemitism, and its links to present-day politics.

node.title: Takeaways from the first day of the Kyle Rittenhouse trial.
node.description: Opening statements from the prosecution and defense were followed by testimony from a friend of Mr. Rittenhouse, an F.B.I. agent and a witness to the unrest in Kenosha, Wis.

node.title: A C.D.C. panel recommends Pfizer-BioNTech’s vaccine for children ages 5 to 11.
node.description: The Biden administration has enlisted 20,000 health workers and shipped 15 million doses ahead of the agency’s decision.

node.title: Initial Playoff Rankings Show Georgia at Top and Numerous Potential Contenders
node.description: The other would-be semifinalists in the first rankings of the College Football Playoff included Alabama, Michigan State and Oregon.

node.title: Ronaldo late equaliser rescues draw for Manchester United
node.description: Cristiano Ronaldo scores two stoppage-time goals in each half to rescue a Champions League point for Manchester United against Atalanta.

node.title: Non-alcoholic drinks are taking up more space on the bottle shop shelf, but do they taste any good?
node.description: Health-conscious consumers are voting with their feet (and taste buds) as non-alcoholic drinks get closer to the real deal.

node.title: 'Our family is whole again': Cleo Smith's family overjoyed by her rescue
node.description: After using her Instagram account to raise awareness about the search for her missing daughter, Ellie Smith was able to post good news this morning.

node.title: British waitress wins High Court battle over 'backpacker tax'
node.description: An English backpacker who worked as a waitress in Sydney said Australia's 'backpacker tax' was discriminatory. Today, she won her High Court battle.

node.title: COP26: The NZer behind a global clean energy initiative
node.description: The 'One Sun, One World, One Grid' plan is to accelerate construction of large solar power stations and wind farms, linked together by grids crossing national borders.

node.title: Why one famous sign company is adding more women to its workforce
node.description: While their name may not ring a bell, it's hard to walk through the nation's capital without seeing their work.

node.title: Supreme Court Hears Free Speech Case on Politician’s Censure
node.description: The justices seemed inclined to find a narrow way to reject the argument that the censure of an elected official in Houston ran afoul of the First Amendment.

node.title: C.D.C. Advisers Recommend Covid Vaccine for Younger Children
node.description: If the agency’s director signs off, as expected, children ages 5 to 11 could begin to receive the shots this week.

node.title: Reporters staked out a Brooklyn block to see if Adams lives there. The results were inconclusive.
node.description: As questions continued to swirl about Mr. Adams’s residence, reporters for Curbed tried to get to the bottom of the matter.

node.title: Voting-rights groups sue to keep polls open in New Jersey for 90 extra minutes.
node.description: The court application asks that polls stay open until 9:30 p.m. to offset delays linked to problems connecting new electronic poll books to the internet.

node.title: Facebook to shut down facial recognition system, delete face prints of 1 billion users
node.description: Facebook will shut down its facial recognition system, which automatically identifies users in photos and videos, amid growing concerns about the use of the technology.

node.title: Victorian Liberal MP caught drink driving won't rule out bid to run next year
node.description: Liberal MP Tim Smith says he will take at least a fortnight to reflect on the future of his political career, a day after Opposition Leader Matthew Guy publicly urged him not to contest the next election.

node.title: Former All Black Carl Hayman diagnosed with dementia
node.description: Former All Black prop Carl Hayman has been diagnosed with early onset dementia and probable chronic traumatic encephalopathy (CTE) at the age of 41.

node.title: Why it took months to get electronics from China to the U.S.
node.description: Electricity outages, worker and truck shortages contributed to delays.

node.title: Pat Martino, Jazz Guitarist Who Overcame Amnesia, Dies at 77
node.description: He was one of the genre’s most acclaimed players when brain surgery left him with no memory. But he recovered and made music for another three decades.

node.title: Passenger Sues Airline in Mask Dispute, Alleges Will to Comply, Injury to Her Wrist, Thumb
node.description: The woman alleges that she and her husband had three extra masks, proof of vaccination, and proof of negative COVID tests, but were still asked to deplane.

node.title: Amazon Begins to Repay Illegally Withheld Tips, Drivers to Receive $422 Each on Average
node.description: The FTC said that one driver would receive over $28,000, while the average amount of 139,507 settlement checks and 1,621 PayPal payments was $422.

node.title: Black Caps need to continue to adapt at World Cup
node.description: The Black Caps will have to adapt to the daytime playing conditions when they face Scotland in tonight's Super 12 match in Dubai.

node.title: Democrats Push for Agreement on Tax Deduction That Benefits the Rich
node.description: Lawmakers are coalescing around a deal to suspend a $10,000 cap on state and local tax deductions that was imposed during the Trump administration.

node.title: Election results in the Virginia governor’s race could take hours or even days.
node.description: Here’s what we know about when to expect a race call in Virginia and in other places holding elections on Tuesday.

node.title: Attorney of Deshaun Watson Accusers Says 'Dolphins Wanted 22 Settlements' for a Trade
node.description: The quarterback will reportedly remain with the Houston Texans after the NFL tradeline passed on Tuesday afternoon.

node.title: Author of 'Jesus Christ, Money Master' Will Spend Rest of Life in Jail Over Ponzi Scheme
node.description: William Neil Gallagher stole $32 million in personal savings from sick and elderly seniors, promising to invest it by using the principles of Jesus Christ.

node.title: 3-Year-Old Among 7 Injured When Car Knocked Into San Diego Restaurant After Crash
node.description: As the result of the prior accident, a Honda flew into the restaurant, injuring those inside both vehicles and a number of people inside the establishment.

node.title: U.S. Reps Want CBP's Internal Report on 2020 Detainment of Iranian Americans at Border
node.description: Washington representatives Pramila Jayapal and Suzan DelBene also demanded that the agency issue a formal public apology for the detainments.

node.title: AFL legend Eddie Betts is about to get back on the field, but his return to footy has a bigger focus
node.description: After two weeks in quarantine Aussie rules legend Eddie Betts is set to debut in the Northern Territory Football League this weekend — and he has big plans for his Top End stay.

node.title: Victoria records 941 new local COVID-19 cases and eight deaths, new tier 1 exposure sites listed
node.description: There are now 18,361 active cases of the virus in Victoria, and 326 people have died during the state's current Delta outbreak.

node.title: House prices shot up as expectation for drop looms
node.description: The pace of rising house prices unexpectedly quickened last month, just as the head of the Reserve Bank says they should start falling.

node.title: Zillow to cut 25% of staff as it closes house-flipping service
node.description: CEO concedes that forecasting housing prices is much harder than the real estate firm expected.

node.title: 3 Big Questions Looming Over the Glasgow Climate Talks
node.description: The biggest one: How many more degrees?

node.title: ‘Isolation’ Review: Dispatches From a Different Pandemic
node.description: In an anthology of nine short films made during the onset of the coronavirus pandemic, people around the world fight to survive.

node.title: The friend who bought the weapon used by Kyle Rittenhouse was the first witness to testify.
node.description: The court heard from Dominick Black, who faces charges of his own for giving Kyle Rittenhouse the semiautomatic rifle he used to shoot three men, two fatally, in Kenosha, Wis.

node.title: Military Grants Few Vaccine Exemptions as Deadlines Loom
node.description: The majority of active-duty troops have gotten a mandatory coronavirus vaccine ahead of deadline, with religious-based exemptions largely dismissed.

node.title: La Palma Volcano Has Cost $116M in Losses to Island's Banana Industry
node.description: "They say it has wiped out 10 percent of the island's economy. I think it is more...it has taken everything," a local banana plantation owner said.

node.title: Youth Climate Activists Want to Take U.S. to Trial Over Anti-Global Warming Actions
node.description: A youth climate change activist group sued the government to change the country's energy system to ensure the future of the environment.

node.title: Workers Begin Delicate Process of Removing Indians Sign From Stadium Scoreboard
node.description: The Cleveland baseball team's scripted logo, located on the Progressive Field, is being removed to prepare for its new Guardians logo.

node.title: Whangārei Hospital: Leaky roofs, dodgy lifts, waiting lists and Covid-19’s here
node.description: Covid-19 has locked down parts of Northland, but if the virus rips through how will Whangārei Hospital cope when the battered building can't even stand up to heavy rain?

node.title: 'Denial of justice' in Chinese couple's residence quest, ex-minister says
node.description: An immigration decision against two suspected spies has the hallmarks of a set-up to deny them justice, according to a former minister and immigration lawyer.

node.title: Rev. Jesse Jackson released from hospital after fall at Howard University
node.description: The 80-year-old was released after spending one night at Howard University Hospital for observation.

node.title: CIA director meets in Moscow with top Russian official amid high tensions
node.description: The Biden administration has been trying to foster a more stable and predictable relationship with the Kremlin.

node.title: Meta Makes Changes to Marketing Strategy Amid Scandals
node.description: After the social media giant auditioned agencies to manage its ad budget, underscoring its Madison Avenue ties, Spark Foundry won the business.

node.title: Zillow, facing big losses, quits flipping houses and will lay off a quarter of its staff.
node.description: The real estate website had been relying on its algorithm that estimates home values to buy and resell homes. That part of its business lost about $420 million in three months.

node.title: Texas Radio Host Who Bilked Listeners Out of Millions Is Sentenced to Life
node.description: William Neil Gallagher, 80, took at least $23 million from more than 190 people to fuel a Ponzi scheme using their retirement savings, according to court records.

node.title: Woman Shot Dead Two Weeks After Finding Tracking Device on Car
node.description: Dancer Abigail Saldaña's employer told police that she had expressed concern over a customer identified as "Stan."

node.title: Brazil's Daily COVID-19 Death Toll Falls to Lowest Level Since Pandemic Began
node.description: The country recorded 2,188 deaths from October 25 to November 1, the lowest recorded weekly death toll from the virus since April of 2020.

node.title: Dems Subpoena ExxonMobile, Chevron Execs, Say They Concealed Climate-Related Evidence
node.description: Rep. Carolyn Maloney said that she tried to get the documents from the oil giants voluntarily, but the companies used tactics like "delay and obstruction."

node.title: Why Is National Debt a Key Issue for Joe Biden's Social Safety Net Bill?
node.description: The National Debt totals over $28 trillion, and Joe Manchin has said he does not want Biden's bill to make things worse.

node.title: SA Police chase border exemption after mother with sick daughter makes noise
node.description: Broken Hill mother Bec Schmidt was planning a trip to Adelaide for her six-year-old daughter Hope's final round of chemotherapy when they were denied entry to SA due to a hasty border closure.

node.title: Housing prices pose risk to New Zealand's financial stability, RBNZ governor says
node.description: The Reserve Bank is reaffirming that house prices are expected to ease, fuelled by record building activity - and governor Adrian Orr says prices are unsustainable and pose risks to the country's…

node.title: Blatter and Platini charged by Swiss prosecutors
node.description: Former Fifa officials Sepp Blatter and Michel Platini have been charged with fraud and other offences in Switzerland.

node.title: Schools estimate several thousand staff are vaccine-resistant
node.description: Principals say some staff are presenting apparently bogus exemption certificates.

node.title: Search continues for men overdue from fishing trip near Raglan
node.description: The pair were at remote Papanui Point in the Ruapuke area and had been due to return on Sunday.

node.title: Ray Sefo: From milk boy to MMA boss
node.description: Ray "Sugarfoot" Sefo was five years old when he was gifted his first pair of boxing gloves. Audio

node.title: Chicago Blackhawks apologize for dismissing sex assault allegation
node.description: "It is clear now that our organization did not do the right thing," the Blackhawks said Monday.

node.title: Russia Conducts Air Defense, Anti-Ship Drills as U.S. Warships Enter Black Sea
node.description: "Just recently, as you know, a U.S. ship entered the Black Sea – it could be seen through binoculars or through the sight of our defense systems," Russian President Vladimir Putin said.

node.title: Los Angeles Rams on Pace to Top Buccaneers Super Bowl Rarity From Last Year
node.description: Should the Rams keep winning, they'll have the easiest playoff road schedule in NFL history.

node.title: Arizona GOP Senate Chief Who Oversaw 2020 Election Audit Retiring, Says 'I Did My Job'
node.description: Senate president in Arizona will not seek reelection and said her involvement in investigating Trump's election fraud claims did not factor into her decision.
